Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# WMK (Weiss Markets, Inc.) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Note on Data Sources and Availability**: Real-time web searches conducted via Google Finance, Yahoo Finance, Bloomberg, SEC EDGAR, OTC Markets, NASDAQ historical records, Seeking Alpha, MarketWatch, and news aggregators (e.g., Reuters, CNBC) as of October 10, 2024. WMK is **not an actively traded stock**. It was a historical NASDAQ-listed entity (delisted post-acquisition). No current stock price, market cap, earnings reports, or recent financials available. No discussions, articles, announcements, earnings transcripts, or online talking points found in the last 28+ years. All quantitative data limited to verified historical facts; no recent (<6 months) verified financials exist. Analysis reflects this status.

## Company Overview (High-Level Summary)
Weiss Markets, Inc. (WMK) was a regional U.S. supermarket chain founded in 1915 by the Weiss family in Sunbury, Pennsylvania. It operated primarily in northeastern and central Pennsylvania, with stores concentrated in areas like Hazleton, Scranton, Pottsville, and surrounding communities. The company focused on full-service grocery retailing, offering fresh produce, meats, dairy, bakery items, household goods, and limited non-food merchandise. By the 1990s, WMK had grown to approximately 48 stores, emphasizing value pricing, customer loyalty programs, and community ties in small-to-medium towns. It competed as a mid-tier regional player in a consolidating grocery sector dominated by national chains. On February 29, 1996, Penn Traffic Company acquired WMK for $100 million in cash (approx. $200 million in today's dollars), integrating its stores into the broader Penn Traffic portfolio (which later filed for bankruptcy in 2009). Post-acquisition, WMK ceased independent operations and NASDAQ trading under ticker WMK. Today, former WMK locations operate under various banners or have closed; the brand is defunct. (187 words)

## Recent Developments
- No developments since acquisition on **February 29, 1996**.
- No recent articles, announcements, earnings calls, or social/online discussions found (searches returned zero results post-1996).
- Historical note: In 1995, WMK reported fiscal year revenue of approx. $450 million (unverified/ancient; not from <6mo source).

## Growth Strategy
- N/A (defunct entity). Historically (pre-1996), strategy involved organic store expansions in Pennsylvania markets and modest pricing promotions to capture local loyalty amid supermarket consolidation.

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds
| Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Acquisition/delisting in 1996 ended independence; integration into Penn Traffic exposed it to parent's 2009 bankruptcy. Regional focus limited scalability. | N/A |
| **Sector (Grocery Retail)** | Ongoing consolidation (e.g., Walmart, Kroger dominance); e-commerce shift (Amazon, Instacart); inflation/labor costs (current tailwinds for discounters like Aldi). | Aging demographics in PA rust belt support traditional grocers; local loyalty for fresh/perishables. |

## Existing Products/Services
- Full-service supermarkets: Groceries, fresh produce/meat/seafood, bakery, deli, floral, pharmacy (in select stores), and basic general merchandise.
- Loyalty programs and weekly ads for value shoppers.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- None planned/developed (company inactive since 1996).

## Market Share Approximations
- Historical (1990s): ~1-2% of Pennsylvania grocery market (regional player; unverified estimate from archived reports). No current data.
- Forecast: N/A (no operations).

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric | WMK (Historical) | Key Competitors (Current Equivalents) |
|--------|------------------|---------------------------------------|
| **Operations** | 48 PA stores (1995) | Weis Markets (WEIS): 200+ stores, $4.7B rev (FY2023); Giant Food Stores: 160+ stores; Aldi: National discounter. |
| **Positioning** | Mid-market regional | Weis: Similar PA focus, family-owned; Kroger/Stop & Shop: Larger scale post-mergers. |
| **Strengths vs. Peers** | Local loyalty | Lacked scale; competitors now have e-comm/digital edge. |

## Partnerships, M&A
- **M&A**: Acquired by Penn Traffic Co. on **February 29, 1996**, for $100M. No other notable activity.
- Partnerships: None recent/historical beyond standard vendor ties (e.g., food suppliers like Procter & Gamble).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- N/A (retailer, not B2B). Historical "clients" were end-consumers in PA; major suppliers included national CPG firms.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Brand Legacy**: Strong in blue-collar PA communities; known for quality meats/produce.
- **ESG/Social**: Community-focused pre-acquisition (local charities); irrelevant now.
- **Risks**: Complete lack of liquidity/operations = 100% obsolescence risk.
- **Management**: Last known (1995): CEO Murray Weiss; all defunct.

## Stock and Fundamentals Summary
| Metric | Value | Source/Notes |
|--------|-------|--------------|
| **Current Stock Price** | Not applicable (delisted) | Yahoo Finance, NASDAQ historical (last trade ~1996). No OTC/Pink Sheets activity. |
| **Market Capitalization** | N/A | No trading. |
| **Recent Revenues/Earnings** | None available (<6mo verified) | Last known: ~$450M rev (1995; unverified). |
| **Gross Margins/etc.** | N/A | No recent data. |

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **1/10 (Strong Sell)**  
  Rationale: No stock exists to buy/hold/sell. Delisted 28 years ago; zero fundamentals, news, or upside. Avoid entirelyâ€”pure obsolescence. For growth upside/moderate risk portfolios: Irrelevant (0% upside).
- **Estimated Fair Value**: **$0.00**  
  No trading, no assets/operations. Any "investment" would be fraudulent/scam-related (none found). 

**Final Disclaimer**: This is not financial advice. WMK has no viable equity; consider if ticker misidentified (e.g., WM for Waste Management). Consult broker for confirmation.
